Race.SpecificTitle: Justice(s) of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace Ward  8
Council Member at Large -- City of Slidell

Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION
(LIBRARY)
(MILLAGE CONTINUATION AND REDEDICATION)

SUMMARY:  15 YEAR, 6.33 MILLS PROPERTY TAX CONTINUATION AND REDEDICATION FOR CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND/OR OPERATING PUBLIC LIBRARY FACILITIES, FURNISHINGS AND EQUIPMENT, AND OTHERWISE SUPPORTING THE PUBLIC LIBRARY SYSTEM IN THE PARISH.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "Parish") continue to levy a special tax of six and thirty three hundredths (6.33) mills (the "Tax") on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $6,157,489 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2024, with the proceeds of the Tax heretofore or hereafter collected, to be rededicated and used for the purpose of constructing, acquiring, improving, maintaining and/or operating public library facilities, furnishings and equipment, and otherwise supporting the public library system in the Parish?

Race.SummaryText:
CHARTER AMENDMENT PROPOSITION
(NO TERM LIMIT)

SUMMARY:  AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE III, SECTION 3-02 TO REPEAL THE TERM LIMIT PROVISION FOR THE OFFICE OF PARISH PRESIDENT.
Race.FullText:
Shall Article III, Section 3-02, be amended to repeal the term limit provision for the office of parish president and hereafter provide as follows:  

"Section 3-02. Election.  

The president shall be elected at large by the qualified voters of the Parish according to the election laws of the state for a four (4) year term. A person who has served as president shall be eligible to qualify as a candidate for president for the succeeding term."?

Race.SpecificTitle: Mosquito Abat. Dist. No.2 -- Parishwide - 5.55 Mill - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
MOSQUITO ABATEMENT DISTRICT NO. 2 PROPOSITION
 (TAX RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 5.55 MILLS PROPERTY TAX RENEWAL FOR PURCHASING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING MACHINERY, FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT NECESSARY OR USEFUL IN THE ERADICATION, ABATEMENT OR CONTROL OF MOSQUITOES AND OTHER ARTHROPODS OF PUBLIC HEALTH IMPORTANCE AND MAINTAINING AN ADEQUATE ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL STAFF FOR MOSQUITO ABATEMENT DISTRICT NO. 2 OF THE PARISH OF ST. TAMMANY.
Race.FullText: Shall the Mosquito Abatement District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a five and fifty-five hundredths (5.55) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017 (the "Tax") (an estimated $6,210,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for the purpose of purchasing, maintaining and operating machinery, facilities and equipment necessary or useful in the eradication, abatement or control of mosquitoes and other arthropods of public health importance and maintaining an adequate administrative and operational staff for the District, said Tax to be a renewal of the taxes authorized to be levied by the District through the year 2007 in the amounts of 4.2 mills and 2.5 mills pursuant to elections held on October 18, 1997 and October 4, 2003, respectively?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No.6 -- $2,000,000 Bond - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 PROPOSITION
(BONDS)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO ISSUE $2,000,000 OF 20 YEAR GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS OF RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 FOR ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING AND IMPROVING PARKS, PLAYGROUNDS AND OTHER RECREATIONAL FACILITIES, TOGETHER WITH FURNISHINGS AND EQUIPMENT THEREFOR, TITLE TO WHICH SHALL BE IN THE PUBLIC, SAID BONDS TO BE PAYABLE FROM AD VALOREM TAXES.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 6, St. Tammany Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000), to run twenty (20) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding eight percent (8%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing and improving parks, playgrounds and other recreational facilities, together with furnishings and equipment therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No.6 -- 6.5 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6 PROPOSITION
(MILLAGE)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 6.5 MILLS PROPERTY TAX FOR ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING, OPERATING AND/OR SUPPORTING PARKS, PLAYGROUNDS, RECREATION CENTERS AND OTHER RECREATIONAL FACILITIES IN RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 6, TOGETHER WITH THE NECESSARY FURNISHING, EQUIPMENT AND PROGRAMS THEREFOR.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 6, St. Tammany Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of six and five tenths (6.5) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $82,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining, operating and/or supporting parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities in the District, together with the necessary furnishings, equipment and programs therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. District No. 6 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Years
Race.SummaryText:
FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 6 PROPOSITION
(MILLAGE RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 10 MILLS PROPERTY TAX RENEWAL FOR ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND/OR OPERATING FIRE PROTECTION FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT IN AND FOR ST. TAMMANY FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 6, INCLUDING EMERGENCY EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES AND FOR PAYING THE COST OF OBTAINING WATER FOR FIRE PROTECTION PURPOSES AND PAYING CHARGES FOR FIRE HYDRANT RENTALS AND SERVICE.
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Fire Protection District No. 6 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a ten (10) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $120,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including emergency equipment and supplies and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and paying charges for fire hydrant rentals and service?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Drain Dist #2-GDD #5 -- $250.00 Annual Parcel Fee - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
SUB-DRAINAGE DISTRICT NO. 2 OF GRAVITY DRAINAGE DISTRICT NO. 5 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  20 YEAR, $250 ANNUAL PARCEL FEE IN SUB-DRAINAGE DISTRICT NO. 2 OF GRAVITY DRAINAGE DISTRICT NO. 5 (MEADOWBROOK SUBDIVISION) FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, OPERATING AND/OR MAINTAINING PROJECTS, WORKS, IMPROVEMENTS AND EQUIPMENT TO IMPROVE AND FACILITATE DRAINAGE WITHIN THE DISTRICT, WITH THE PROCEEDS OF SAID PARCEL FEE BEING AUTHORIZED TO BE FUNDED INTO BONDS.
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-Drainage District No. 2 of Gravity Drainage District No. 5 (Meadowbrook Subdivision) of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of Two Hundred Fifty Dollars ($250) on each lot, sub-divided portion of ground and/or individual tract located in the District for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2026 (an estimated $123,250 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of said parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of constructing, acquiring, operating and/or maintaining projects, works, improvements and equipment to improve and facilitate drainage within the District and the District being further authorized to fund the proceeds of said parcel fee into bonds to be issued in series from time to time to pay for such capital improvements in the manner provided by law?
